security: Disclosing that SCALETTI was working in Mexico under tourist cover, and that other Station employees were also utilizing tourist cover, reveals sensitive operational methods of the CIA. This could compromise current and future operations, making it easier for foreign governments to identify and track CIA personnel.
summary: Elsie L. Scaletti recalls Agee's limited involvement with Cuban operations at the Mexico City Station and recounts her interactions with him, including a chance encounter where she informed the new COS, John A. Probert, about Agee's resignation under a cloud.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum for the record, dated May 31, 1972, details Elsie L. Scaletti's recollections regarding Philip Agee's involvement with Cuban operations at the Mexico City Station. Scaletti notes that Agee offered little assistance to the Cuban Section, had minimal discussions about the Olympics target, and likely had limited knowledge of station operations. She also recounts social interactions with Agee and a chance encounter after the arrival of John A. Probert, during which she advised Probert to get briefed on Agee's assignment and resignation.
title: Agee Effort Against Cuban Operations at the Mexico City Station
